histogram.name: Login.AllowlistCOILFallback
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of cases where the user_allowlist policy is not present, forcing us to use the user_whitelist policy instead. We emit false to this histogram when user_allowlist is present. We emit true when user_allowlist is not present and user_whitelist is present and used as fallback. These checks happen during login policies decoding, which occurs every time device settings are loaded or stored.

histogram.name: Login.ArcBugReportBackupTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the time to back up ARC bug reports when starting ARC fails. This is emitted when we upgrade the ARC container from mini to full.

histogram.name: Login.ArcContinueBootImpulseStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of Arc continue boot impulse. This is emitted every time we upgrade from a mini to full container.

histogram.name: Login.ArcContinueBootImpulseTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the time to execute arc-boot-continue impulse. This is emitted when we successfully upgrade the ARC container from mini to full.

histogram.name: Login.ArcContinueBootImpulseTime2
histogram.summary: Tracks the time to execute arc-boot-continue impulse. This is emitted when we successfully upgrade the ARC container from mini to full. This metrics increases the number of buckets to 50 and a maximum duration of 60 seconds.

histogram.name: Login.ArcContinueBootImpulseTime3
histogram.summary: Tracks the time to execute arc-boot-continue impulse. This is emitted when we successfully upgrade the ARC container from mini to full. This metrics increases the number of buckets to 50 and a maximum duration of 40 seconds.

histogram.name: Login.BrowserShutdownTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the browser process shutdown time from when SIGTERM is sent to the browser process to when the browser process group exits (or gets killed by SIGABRT).

histogram.name: Login.ConsumerNewUsersAllowed
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram tracking, per consumer sign-in, whether the device owner is allowing arbitrary accounts to be used on the device, or only those on a specific whitelist.

histogram.name: Login.CustomFlags
histogram.summary: A set of chrome flags that triggered browser restart on Chrome OS after user sign in. Chrome needs to be restarted if the device owner set of flags is different from the user flags. Which means that there is a flag difference which led to this restart. This difference is reported by this metric.

histogram.name: Login.FailureReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS login failure reason.

histogram.name: Login.Flow.{UserVisibility}.{UserCount}
histogram.summary: Report the type of user login and the number of it on a device. It is triggered when a login is successful

histogram.name: Login.InvalidCombinationsOfAllowedUsersPolicies
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of cases where devices have an invalid combination of allow_new_users and user_allowlist policies. This is emitted during the decoding of login policies.

histogram.name: Login.LeastUsedAccountDays
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of the days since the least frequently used account signed in. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.NewUserPriorityPrefsSyncResult
histogram.summary: Records whether a new user's priority prefs sync timed out.

histogram.name: Login.NewUserPriorityPrefsSyncTime
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting for priority preferences to sync after new user sign in. The operation will time out after 10s.

histogram.name: Login.NumberOfUsersOnLoginScreen
histogram.summary: Records the number of users the login screen was initialized with. It is emitted on processing the user list before displaying the screen. The count includes all Regular, Child and Active Directory users.

histogram.name: Login.OfflineLoginWithHiddenUserPods
histogram.summary: Records offline login attempts with user pods hidden on the login screen.

histogram.name: Login.OfflineSuccess.Attempts
histogram.summary: On offline login success, records number of attempts, including success.

histogram.name: Login.PageLoad.DetectionType
histogram.summary: Type of login detected for a page load based on different heuristics. Recorded once per page load.

histogram.name: Login.PasswordChanged.ReauthReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason why a user was sent through the GAIA re-auth flow which caused the local password change.

histogram.name: Login.PasswordNotChanged.ReauthReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason why a user was sent through the GAIA re-auth flow which did not cause the local password change.

histogram.name: Login.PasswordStoreSites.InitializedBeforeQuery
histogram.summary: Records whether the passworded sites list is initialized when the query for sites happens. This is used to measure how many queries happened before the list got populated the first time. Recorded on every query to the password store.

histogram.name: Login.PolicyFilesStatePerBoot
histogram.summary: The state of Chrome OS owner key and device policy files.

histogram.name: Login.PromptToCompleteLoginTime
histogram.summary: Time from first display of the login prompt until the user completes signing in.

histogram.name: Login.PromptToLoginTime
histogram.summary: Time from first display of the login prompt until the existing user completes signing in.

histogram.name: Login.ReauthToken.FetchDuration.{Result}
histogram.summary:
Records the fetch duration of the reauth request token from the recovery service when it {Result}. This is recorded on the GAIA reauth screen when Cryptohome recovery is deemed to be needed in high probablity.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-06-02 to 2022-08-18; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Login.SessionExitType
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a ChromeOS user was logged out because Chrome repeatedly crashed.

histogram.name: Login.StateKeyGenerationStatus
histogram.summary: Result of a state key generation operation.

histogram.name: Login.SuccessReason
histogram.summary: Chrome OS login success reason.

histogram.name: Login.SwitchToFeatureFlagMappingStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks whether switches were mapped to feature flags in session_manager for compatibility. session_manager does this and emits UMA samples when encountering old device settings files that still contain feature configuration in command line switch representation. This data will inform the decision when to remove this compatibility code.

histogram.name: Login.TokenCheckResponseTime
histogram.summary: Time between sending a request to, and receiving a reply from, GAIA token endpoint to validate TokenInfo.

histogram.name: Login.TokenObtainResponseTime
histogram.summary: Time between sending a request to, and receiving a reply from, GAIA token endpoint to obtain TokenInfo.

histogram.name: Login.UsersActive28Days
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of number of users who have logged in in the last 28 days. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.UsersActiveDaily
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of number of users who have logged in in the last day. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.UsersActiveWeekly
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of number of users who have logged in in the last 7 days. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.UsersActiveWeekly.Percent
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of percentage of local users who have logged in in the last 7 days. Reported on every boot and once a day after that.

histogram.name: Login.UserType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of the way a user logs in and whether Chrome OS is running normal or developer mode.
